website_summaries.verdict: If you want a popular Garmin system with an impressive feature set, the DriveSmart 61 is a close contender for the best.
pros: Features a large screen with all the bells and whistles, including reliable smart technology and Bluetooth connectivity
Offers real-time updates on traffic and parking when using compatible smartphone app
cons: Interface comes with a learning curve
Sound may not be loud enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product you will get the shaft twice ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product you will get the shaft twice!!!! The GPS device I received did not hold a charge. It would only work when plugged in. I simply wanted to exchange it for a new one. The seller is requiring me to pay the shipping back to them for a defective product! Update. I did not take my own advice. I decided to buy a second one and it stopped working within 4 months. I am assuming it the same charging issue I had from the first one I got. This model is horrible. Garmin should be embarrassed by this model.
customer_reviews.author: ImYourHuckleBerry223

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service from Garmin = No more Garmin for me!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a new (not refurbished) Garmin. The voice prompts did not work from day 1. We kept thinking it was an incorrect setting on our part. After a few months of not figuring it out, we contacted Garmin. We sent our newly purchased Garmin in and recieved a refurbished garmin back in the mail. I purchased a new Garmin and I expect a new one in return, not a refurbished Garmin that has been used. If I wanted a refurbished one, I would have bought a refurbished one to begin with. I have purchased over 20 Garmin products in the past and I refuse to purchase another Garmin if this is their customer service policy. Bye bye Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: No more Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Second Garmi unit that just quit working. Will not buy again. Oh, checked for a fix. “Could be bad or loose batteries” so I hear ? Thanks Garmin for using micro SQUARE head screws, not Phillips or flathead screws. I might have had a chance to repair / check batteries, but NOPE - who carries tiny square screwdrivers ? Only had this unit 6 months at the most. Luckily, I have my cellphone for directions.
customer_reviews.author: TexasSpike

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Cool gps. I don't have to plug it to my pc or laptop for updates. Just connect it to the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: walj

customer_reviews.title: GPS nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Been using garmin gps for over 30 years in multiple cars, delivery/service trucks and boats. I know how they are supposed to work. This is second unit within one month from two differs suppliers. Day one, over 12 hours of service calls with three hours of driving time, lost satellite over 30 times, Day two, half hour ride, lost satellite for twenty minutes and phone speaker crapped out. Still loyal to garmin so trying nuvi 67 and separate hands free phone mic/speaker.
customer_reviews.author: rwischkin

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but what is?
customer_reviews.text: 1. No charge cable included HOWEVER if you plug in the included usb cable and leave it connected to your computer it will slowly but surely charge the device (even though it will say this cable will not charge it when plugged in). 2. You have to borderline shout at it for the voice command features to work if you're about 3 feet away from it. 3. Some of the features (live traffic) require additional purchases. Overall I recommend getting it if you want a dedicated GPS as it's better than the competition from the research I've done.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ford

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit, nice large display, and lots of features
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a very large screen, which is a huge plus. After spending 1 1/2 hours updating the software and maps, it still has a few bugs to work out. Sometimes the map shows that I need to be in the far left lane, but the voice directions say "keep right. Keep right". Then at the last second, it will all of a sudden say "keep left." If you're not really paying attention, you could be heading the wrong way and be late to wherever you're going! I like all the features and the speaker is more than adequate. All in all, it's a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last !
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased in August, it started to malfunction late September, service said to upload updates available so I did. It worked on and off through October running updates two more times. By mid November it completely died, this either a very bad product or we got a lemon, either way we are out the cost as the company does not stand behind their product. No exchange -no return
customer_reviews.author: B. Jewett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome GPS
customer_reviews.text: We have utilized a TomTom for 5 years and recently purchased the Smart 61 NA LMT-S. 6.9" Version. And the Garmin is hands down a far superior product than the TomTom we've used for the past 5 years.. Voice recognition is almost flawless for navigation of the menu items and for making menu adjustments via voice commands however, demonstrating some issues when inputting the intended travel to address. Garmin really did a spectacular job with this GPS and is a pleasure to use. Simple, logical, user friendly and un-intimidating. A Great GPS!
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: works great for me
customer_reviews.text: i was worried because i read a bunch of reviews that seemed bad. but so far i have had no problems. update your maps and charge completely before using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going to Canada? Get it.
customer_reviews.text: General: nice display, extensive descriptive spoken commands, voice recognition feature is very useful Re Canada Works well concerning roundabouts...usually. Nice to have both miles and mph on Garmin for mental estimating and also kilometers per hour on car speedometer for speed limits. Took a lot of stress out of driving in a metric country.
customer_reviews.author: Gator biker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing. Very sad.
customer_reviews.text: Maps are seriously inconsistant and inaccurate! What happened, Garmin? Are you outsourcing you cartography to Indonesia? And the searches are totally out of whack. I can sit outside a McDonald's and search for one; closest is 40 miles away yet there I am sitting at the one shown on the screen. I've had about 5 of these over the years, they die but I always another because they are great. No more. This is the last one. Was Garmin acquired by a Chinese company? What is it, Garmin? You have devolved!
customer_reviews.author: GeoMac

customer_reviews.title: Too much info. you don't need.
customer_reviews.text: Too much info. It tells you about every curve in the road ahead. Every school zone, which is alright but it won't go away when your through, you have go back and reset it. The dashboard on my old Garmin was more user friendly. When you type in an address and it is muted, right when you need it the most the screen will change from a map to written directions You have to take your eyes off the road and read. I've tried to reset all the settings to no avail. The only thing good is the size of the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Frida Brashear

customer_reviews.title: Dependence on "Smart Phone" for all the neat stuff; total bummer!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the images of the dual screens and descriptions, I thought this unit had a forward-facing camera built in with the option for a rear-facing camera! I just received it and learned that it has NO camera and all the "neat" features rely on the unit being paired with a Bluetooth Smart Phone to provide the Google Earth street level data for the split screen! Very, very disappointed in the requirement for a "smart phone!" All these same features are available via apps on smart phones! So what's the up-side to spending ~$300 on this unit?
customer_reviews.author: Griz Rhodus

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Screen responded to touch only occasionally. I sent it back. Full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: NO TRAFFIC ANTENNA
customer_reviews.text: Lots of option and a great product but takes some getting use to if you have owned an older one and are upgrading. Does not come with the traffic antenna power cable and will cost an additional $60-70 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Davenprot

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work very well. Didn't really want to spend this much, but the option of updating via wifi vs garmin express is a no duh. Upgraded the maps and operating system in about 45 minutes. Don't like the smartphone link requirements for the live parking and camera options. Purchased a separate power cord with traffic receiver ($67 from Walmart) so I don't have to use my phone for traffic. Voice command is off and on, but it could be because I have a deep voice and something of a lisp. I recommend it over the Majellan 7" with far less features I just gave away.
customer_reviews.author: AMD Quad Core

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with a traffic compatible power cable.
customer_reviews.text: My old Nuvi had a traffic compatible power cable as part of the standard delivery. I just received my DriveSmart 61 yesterday and installed it today. Nope, that cable costs an extra $61 (including tax). Total rip off. I am pissed and let Garmin know. I don't want to use a smartphone interface, but expected performance at least as good as my old unit. Very upset at Garmin and I do not plan on buying any more Garmin products.
customer_reviews.author: James Wehner

customer_reviews.title: The WIFI update rarely works.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this GPS initially. Good screen, routes were good, synced to my phone easily. Updated my maps and software over WIFI easily. UNTIL this year. I tried to update with WIFI and it kept telling me an error occured and go to the computer to Garmin Express. Well I cannot use it with my IPAD no USB ports. I bought this specifically so I wouldnt have to shag a computer with me. Now I am on excellent WIFI and for over a week I keep getting the same error message. I am very disappointed in this feature. They need to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Bell

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Can't really say there's anything wrong with this Garmin - it does what it's supposed to do very well - but I put this and my phone on the dashboard and I found Google Maps to be better. There are a couple of minor features on the Garmin that aren't on Google Maps and vice versa, but not enough difference to justify the cost unless you really need the bigger screen. I like how it connects to the phone for live traffic and data, but once again if you just use Google Maps you get that anyway for free.
customer_reviews.author: SG in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this! Shop around
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this GPS for a month and already it wont turn on. before that it would never update, gave directions to wrong locations or locations that didn't exit anymore (probably because it needed updated). Always contacted to a my bluetooth no matter what device and disabled it from anything else. It didn't calculate distance correctly and the list goes on and on. I returned mine for a full refund and once again I have to go look for another gps unit, maybe I'll just buy an unlimited for my cell phone and use that.

customer_reviews.title: Good but has issues
customer_reviews.text: It's a great device but it has some issues, the screen is perfect and everything works as it should EXCEPT Bluetooth keeps disconnecting from my Samsung Galaxy S7. I have tried everything but it still want's to disconnect. I will change my review when a software update is put out to fix the issue which is hopefully sometime soon. Also they could add in the feature of saying "Okay Garmin" to the GPS like the new Garmin Dash Cam 55 is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: The worst voice recognition of the 21st century
customer_reviews.text: As a GPS, the Garmin DriveSmart 61 works reasonably well. The screen sensitivity is much better, closer to smart phone than the usual Etch-a-Sketch feel of other Garmin models. I'm knocking the 61 down because it has the worst voice recognition software of any product ever. This Garmin makes Alexa look like Star Trek's universal translator. It's horrible. I'm a native English speaker and have no discernable accent. I enunciate clearly and speak with reasonable tone and pitch. There's simply no excuse for voice recognition software to be this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Decker

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished junk
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd attempt at ordering a refurbished unit. 1st one would not update using wifi. The 2nd unit wouldn't charge with the supplied cable and would not update as well. Since I paid extra for a wifi model it should update using that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Rich D.

customer_reviews.title: Best hardware I have owned from Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features, smartlink app, live updates for traffic, works well. Sometimes the audio directions and on screen prompts conflict with each other. Speed limits are often wrong. Bluetooth speaker phone worked very well when brand new, however now everyone tells me they cannot hear me and I am always cutting out. Voice recognition does not work as well as when new either. Might have a problem with the built in mic.
customer_reviews.author: Jose D. Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: We are very satisfied. The battery indicator showed low battery so I left the GPS connected in the car for 5 or 6 hours and that was sufficient to fully charge the battery. Then I connected the GPS to my computer and updated the maps. The 7-inch diagonal screen is the perfect size for easy viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Jack98110

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It is very good to use Helpful I love alot alot Just would like more updates
customer_reviews.author: Egyptian

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: After returning an identical model I made the mistake of buying the same one again. Big mistake. Both would not hold a charge and then they wouldn't even turn on unless plugged in. I am appalled that Garmin would put it's name on such an inferior product. I need GPS for work and I can't keep it plugged in because I need to keep my laptop charged. Looks like I may try another Tom Tom.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for non-phone gps
customer_reviews.text: Husbands new truck had the iPhone integration built into it so his phone gps would link to his screen. However he discovered that he had problems using his phone to talk and still access the gps. He travels constantly for work so we knew we’d need another option for gps and picked this one. It has a little bit of a learning curve but once my husband figured it out he was very happy with it. Nice screen graphics and works flawlessly. Very happy we picked this one!
customer_reviews.author: Blondesaurus72

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent GPS, works with Android
customer_reviews.text: I really love this unit... Easy to program.. Blue tooth connectivity for Traffic and more... Using the connect app, I can send my destination contact from Google to my GPS vs entering manually, or saving into Garmin.. Excellent unit, nice size screen, easy to use. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Garmin DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S
customer_reviews.text: I'm older, need a bigger screen. This is great! Voice recognition is much improved over the last two years. Speak slowly one number or word at time and it will actually come up with the correct place. So easy to use, touch screen and voice. Actually bought 3, one for each member of the family that drives, and they can't say enough great things about this. Better than the phone app. Bought the traffic cord for each also.
customer_reviews.author: kids_bus_driver

customer_reviews.title: Very good GPS with a few quirks
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this GPS is very good, the voice recognition is about 85% accurate. Occasionally I find it difficult to find a location by voice only. Using the shortest route mode, the mapping software often sends me in very strange directions. The end result may be correct but during testing of locations that I knew, I was able to take much more direct routes then the mapping software suggested. Even with its quirks, this is the best GPS that I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Streeter

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but ...
customer_reviews.text: Good unit but , map look very poor instead TomTom GPS and there is no actual traffic function, to use that option you need some additional equipment and some subscription of service ... which is weird . Update , become very slow after couple of months, sometimes doesn't turn on and battery drained crazy fast . Look like their sell refurbished units instead new .
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Not to good for $300.00. Phone navigation is way more accurate
customer_reviews.text: Shipping fast, no troubles w/ seller. Garmin mapping is horrible. Takes me down country roads instead of directly to main hwys. Have tried both fastest route and shortest. Also does not list most hwys in turn by turn. Example, hwy 8 in Polk county Wisconsin is only listed as 130th Ave. It should list as 130th Ave/Hwy 8. Gets confusing, and is easier following hey signs versus Ave/St signs.
customer_reviews.author: K Blank

customer_reviews.title: Can not find satellites most of the time
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst Garmin GPS I have ever seen. It has problems finding satellites even in open spaces. We used it in a 2019 Land Rover & a Jaguar E Pace. Every time I had to take it out of the window to find the satellites. It did not work in a cloudy day at all. The Garmin people were not able to help. We finally ended up using Google Pixel 4 cell to navigate. What a waste of money & time.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hayer

customer_reviews.title: Best brand out there
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter ( new driver ) >>>> yea.... I don't get much sleep any more - LOL <<<< Garmin is the best GPS you can buy Screen is crisp - touch-pad very reliable - volume is very good I bought this mainly because mine is still working GREAT and I bought it in 2010 and use it daily. Pull the trigger - - buy it and quit wasting time reading reviews - - - LOL Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Bull

customer_reviews.title: Not better than my old Nuvii
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old Nuvii after it died. The DriveSmart is supposed to have advanced features but I found the traffic updates to be lacking, but my old one was late with alerts too. The alerts for wildlife and speed limit changes are nice. I went with the larger screen 61 which is a big improvement when it comes to entering addresses (no more fat fingering). Like others interested in a stand alone GPS instead of using your smartphone, I'd say this is still a very good choice. GARMIN makes a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome. I love the size
customer_reviews.text: The screen is well...awesome. I love the size!! I like how my phone notifications are displayed onto my Garmin. The directions so far have been accurate. So far, my only gripe, voice commands are terrible. I tell it an address, and it gives me an entirely different address not within the city. I wish it had a function that learns your voice like cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Beyond that works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and exactly as I need it to. The updating can be a little slow at times but no need for a cellular connection to make it work. My only word of caution is if you are going to any very rural area be careful and check the routing it will route you down some roads that arent really passable. Beyond that works great.
customer_reviews.author: DWD

customer_reviews.title: Directions accuracy is not great
customer_reviews.text: First time using, Out of my neighborhood it told me to turn west to my eastern destination. My heart sank. On that city test trip it did pretty well, but reinforces two facts about GPS: (1) You better have a good idea of where you should be going so you can catch a bad instruction and (2) they were a lot more accurate ten years ago. Other than that, nice screen, nice voice and easy to use. It’s just that, well, it may get you lost or take forever to get you somewhere. Hope it gets better with updates.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: why so many good review
customer_reviews.text: i returned 2 of this gps , first one worked very good for 3 weeks then the screen frozen i couldn't turn it off or type... as i really liked the big screen and the smartphone link , i bought another one from a different seller but this one only worked normal for about an hour then the screen went frozen for 2 hours then turned off itself ...so disappointed ,send it back paid the shipping fee for the defective gps.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: NO UPDATES AVAILABLE VIA WI-FI,  support wants to install software on my PC "to allow access"
customer_reviews.text: I like the GPS. Works great. One of the promised features is free updates for the map and the operating software. Not apparently available. It connects to my wi-fi, but says "update server not available, try later" -- so I connected to the PC and tried to update using the "Garmin Express" program described in the instructions. Nope! So chatted with support, then the man called me, told me he'd have to install "access software" on my PC. I told him no. So, good product, don't believe the update promises.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Would no longer power-on after very light and gentle usage. - Retired ELECTRONICS Engineer
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working - would no longer power-on - after very light and gentle usage (and, yes, it was plugged in and the Garmin CHARGER was operating properly). Always immediately returned to optional zipper case. Never dropped. Never exposed to extreme temperatures. Never subjected to excessive vibration or G-forces. As such, and as a retired Engineer (Consumer ELECTRONICS), I can state authoritatively that I now have very poor regard for, and would never again purchase, any Garmin products. Had a "nice" discussion about Garmin's "quality" with my fellow Executives on the Golf course.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN A NOTT

customer_reviews.title: An easy to use GPS with a great display and great features.
customer_reviews.text: To begin, I have a factory GPS built into my 2018 vehicle. It is NOWHERE close to being as convenient as this unit. The voice command feature is not perfect...but it is VERY GOOD. So handy to add a coffee stop to your route without having to take your eyes off the road. I just drove across the country with this Garmin unit. It performed flawlessly. I also bought the traffic cable. This saved a ton of time, especially going through the cities. I recommend the 61 NA LMT-S as well as the traffic cable without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Stellerman

customer_reviews.title: DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S wait till the next generation
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S is a good GPS system however it is lacking in basic voice recognition. Words that my Smartphone easily understands, the DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S does not. An example of this would be the name of a thrift store.... " Goodwill " it cannot seem to understand this, coming up with outrageous replies like " Did you say PapCo Oil or Thornton Square? " neither of these places exist in our area! So unless you have to have one right now wait till the next generation comes out.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: would not recharge after first use
customer_reviews.text: really excited to get this and maybe save on data on phone. just relocated so use maps a lot. used it once and left in car. battery died and WOULD NOT recharge!! EERRRR....... So I returned and bought a new phone with more memory and large enough screen and a battery that for all intents and purposes will not die!!!
customer_reviews.author: Be11a

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished just as good as NEW!  Save some $$
customer_reviews.text: For Drive Smart 61 NA LMT-S (Refurb) Sharp Display, Fast Processor, No Issues! I bought this as REFURBISHED and it looks as if it was just placed into a Refurbished box from a Retail box it was so clean and scratchless. For Live Traffic, this unit DOES require a Mobile Phone with App installed and running. (Unlike the Live Traffic that was built into the Cigarette lighter adapter in Garmins of the past) I already have 2 other Garmins that 'Used' the Garmin SmartLink app so I already had it installed. All Purchase/Subscriptions I opted for came right on over to this new GPS. 5 Stars! and a 6th Star for Great Price on Refurbished that is LIKE NEW!
customer_reviews.author: Dyseman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent GPS
customer_reviews.text: Compared to an older GPS model I have, this larger screen model is excellent. This GPS comes with many added icons to use. When you receive it, you only get the bare bones accessories. You will have to purchase the updated Garmin GTM 60 HD Digital Traffic Receiver cable to receive Red Light Camera info, road and very up to date road conditions, etc. The cable included is a beyond basic cable to just turn on the GPS. After using it several times, I would purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Conan the Barbarian

customer_reviews.title: Need to buy the radio cable for traffic updates without a cell phone
customer_reviews.text: This GPS is OK. Traffic updates require you to use your cell phone. The traffic updates require the optional radio cable if you do not want to use your cell phone. I have not been able to get the time of day displayed on the navigation display. My old Tom Tom had this feature and I miss it. I find my old Tom Tom GPS had a more intuitive menu than the Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: Reading previous reviews, I was afraid to try a new one, but this Garmin saved the day for me recently when I had to drive from Bradley International Airport to Wassaic, NY after 9 PM. The roads are mainly country and state roads, single lanes, curvy, hilly roads with sudden sharp turns without street lights. I got to my destination safely by following Garmin's directions blindly. I did not have a chance to try other features of the Garmin, but the main ones seem to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Hducle

customer_reviews.title: so the technology is so much better, also the link to the smart phone is ...
customer_reviews.text: This has everything that I need, of course it replaced a 10 year old Garmin, so the technology is so much better, also the link to the smart phone is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Yoi Double Yoi

customer_reviews.title: Cannot charge at home. Smart features only if connected to phone
customer_reviews.text: I like the screen and screen touch response time. Setup and update was easy. The big problem is I cannot charge this at home. I am using the cable that came with the packet. I am also using a charger that has more than 2 AMP output. When I plug it onto a USB wall charger, it says "The attached cable cannot currently charge your device". The drive smart feature works when you connect it to a smart phone. I use a GPS device so I can use my phone for other purposes. If the phone is connected to the GPS, I cannot connect it to the car audio system. That is not smart at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Voice activated
customer_reviews.text: The speed limits are often wrong and I can't change them like I could with my last Garmin. Other than that, it does everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: stillbliss

customer_reviews.title: The Best GPS I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: First of all, let me say I've had this for a while. It's taken me from Florida to Canada, and a number of place in between. It has never let me down. I like the graphics, like the little side features of alerting me to speed limit changes or railroad tracks or whatever. I also like that it has a more horizontal screen, kind of like smaller version of a good HD screen. I find nothing to give any serious demerit to this unit. I wish all electronics worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: Devlin Faust

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t download the traffic app from Garmin, so I sent the GPS back
customer_reviews.text: I tried several time to download the app from the Garmin website to be able connect the GPS to my phone for traffic updates. Each time I got a message that the downloads was not possible. I checked the Apple App Store and there was no Garmin app there. I was then left with the option of purchasing the special cable to be able to get traffic that way or send the GPS back and continue to use Waze. I chose to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: A must when traveling.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it so much I bought a second one and it sent to my daughter who had an older small screen garmin. Large screen great for old eyes. Used for thousands of miles for trips to Florida and California and cities in between and worked well in all locations. I was able to plan out each gas station/hotel stop and have then loaded into the trip planner. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Putt

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Used it on vacation for the first time. Voice recognition is a great feature. You can tell it to find an address or place. Works best if you speak loudly and clearly. Nice large display with good looking maps. Gives good advance warning of upcoming changes. I owned a TomTom previously which I liked but this GPS really adds all the extra useful touches that make it well worth it. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Grouchyf

customer_reviews.title: Best Navigation Device!
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute BEST navigation device I’ve EVER owned! It’s a little pricey...but sometimes you get what you pay for! Took and used it on a road trip to Tampa the next day after it was delivered and it worked perfect! It’s definitely a few notches above my Magellan. Self-explanatory set up and very user friendly...I’d recommend this device to anyone who’s looking for a quality navigation device. Also, VERY FAST SHIPPING!
customer_reviews.author: Fly Gambino

customer_reviews.title: Great successor to my Nuvi 50
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a 9-year old Nuvi with free map upgrades and it works better than the built-in satnav in my last two cars. But I wanted a larger one for my Odyssey that does not have nav. This is great, I got it on sale in July and everything in my old Nuvi was easily transferred to this model. Big improvement in size and touch screen, but overall, it works much like my old Nuvi, which is great! Lifetime maps. What can go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Savageone

customer_reviews.title: Love the bigger display and new features
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade from a Garmin Nuvi 60. Love the bigger display and new features..."entering school zone" (beep alert and displayed alert" Upgraded to the 61 NA so I could add the Garmin backup camera. (Haven't installed camera yet, but installation looks about as simple as you could get. Lot's of new features that will take me a while to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Howell

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a refurbished unit, but should have been labeled "a garbage unit"!
customer_reviews.author: Rosalio Ross Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Um...wow, this is a great GPS! I bought this to update our old Garmin and this one is amazing. The screen is huge, it gives very detailed directions, it warns you about upcoming red lights and it gives a ton of suggestions for gas, food and lodging options along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work in law enforcement. I selected this model that way I could input addresses while driving and not having to use the device. While this does a pretty good job, if there is background noise or music this will be unable to understand my voice/ commands. Overall, this does a fantastic job. The touch screen is responsive and the screen is large and bright. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on anything else
customer_reviews.text: This has a large clear screen, works immediately out of the box, voice command is excellent. No manual needed, just turn it on and start nav. Perfect add to any vehicle without built-in nav. I ended up purchasing for family members because they liked ours so much.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Schade

customer_reviews.title: Not updated and difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The software on the new Garmin was not updated and had a huge file to download so it couldn't be done in the car. That was a set back. After it was updated, the system was not user friendly and difficult to use. Settings seemed to reset when the unit was turned off. Battery life was not functional and the unit had to be plugged in which made mounting in one place difficult. Overall, would never buy again. Way easier to just use your phone which is unfortunately illegal in some states now.
customer_reviews.author: RP Maley

customer_reviews.title: I like it better than my phone or my old GPS --- it works !! A+
customer_reviews.text: I like it better than my phone or my old GPS --- it works !! A+ I turn it on whenever I am driving so I can see all of the road names. It even warns me when I am speeding. I will have fun figuring out what else it can do. A+
customer_reviews.author: CCrow

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Nice size 7” display. Has vivid screen. I moved to a new area and use to find restaurants and parks and activities. Sometimes doesn’t always take the easiest route but gets me to where I need to go. Easier than relying on phone and I don’t worry about getting a ticket or being distracted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: inconsistently offers up to 2 route options while TomTom offers 3 options
customer_reviews.text: Although the device works fairly well, a couple of issues are worth noting: 1. The device inconsistently offers up to 2 route options sometimes. My 10 year old TomTom device consistently offers 3 options: fastest, shortest and "avoid highways" which is my favorite option, as it is an optimal, happy medium smartest route. I still choose to use my old TomTom! 2. When selecting Home as my destination, I am never offered any route options, when I know there are 2-3-4 routes home.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Switched from TomTom, there lifetime updates are a fraude.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Voice activation does not work well which seems to be normal with gps devices. TomTom advertised lifetime updates and after a short time the device lost its signal. I received an email to update my device and when I went to the website, o was informed that my device is no longer supported after it was just a little over a year old.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Bad service replacing a defective one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this end of November 2017. 7 months later it is dead as a doornail. Called Garmin support and they will replace it under warranty -- 10 to 14 business days after they receive it back. This is a really unreasonable time to get me a replacement. It should take 2-3 days at most. When I bought it it took 2 days to get me one. When their product is defective it is 2-3 weeks. Plus they will only send a refurb. I bought a new one. I expect better than this from Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: DaveKathy Leary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent GPS
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using it traveling thru Pennsylvania. Sometimes it doesn't recognize my voice commands, this is a minor issue. The big display and usage of the touchscreen makes it a pleasure to navigate. I highly recommend this GPS unit.
customer_reviews.author: Atarian

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME UNIT
customer_reviews.text: Easiest GPS I ever had to set up. Used it twice to and from same location same day. Intentionally deviated from GPS track both times to check length of recalculation time and how close to original directions it would take me. Short recalculation time and not way off original track. Voice command worked perfectly. Spoken directions were very clear and easy to understand. In bright sunlight I had no problem seeing the screen. Additional information brought up by touching the icons on the screen was plentiful and helpful info. THIS IS THE BEST UNIT OF 4 THAT I'VE OWNED!!! If you need a simple to operate more than adequately programmed GPS THIS IS THE ONE TO BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really update over WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't update over WiFi. Repeated attempts on different networks fail with message saying that an an error occurred (no specifics) and I should use Garmin Express to update. I use Linux and Chromebook computers for which Garmin does not supply the Garmin Express program. This is why I bought a supposedly WiFi upgradable model in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Love this GPS
customer_reviews.text: I am an 88+ senior who can get lost in a paper bag. I can't say enough about this GPS. It got to a street that I NEVER could have found because it was so far from where I live. The instructions were easy to follow - the voice was clear and I just couldn't believe that little gadget got me to my destination.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: 7 month duration! Terrible quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the DriveSmart on June 25, 2019. It quit working altogether the end of January 2020. I took it out and brought it in and checked different cables....nope! It won’t power up, doesn’t seem to even charge. Seven months! That’s all it lasted. With just average use.
customer_reviews.author: Tiggeez

customer_reviews.title: Love this would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is second one we’ve bought great price and works so much better then other brands we’ve purchased in past user friendly no typing just use voice command
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality/value
customer_reviews.text: Does not always recognize my accent but can get what I need by manually input, This GPS only gets better with time, the longer I have it the more I like it. I would like to find out how I can see how many miles left as opposed to just the ETA. but maybe next week I can find that out.
customer_reviews.author: snowflashdrop

customer_reviews.title: It's not smart, but it's effective.
customer_reviews.text: Besides having the most brainless voice recognition system since literally ever, it does what I need. Traffic notifications don't work, at all, but I'm a basic guy. I just want the turn by turn. It gets 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 of (5) because of the basic functions, the phenomenal sensitivity on the screen, and because it is hilarious the results it comes up with when using voice recognition. And yes, I speak clearly and concisely.
customer_reviews.author: SergeantAmerica

customer_reviews.title: i like the large screen size
customer_reviews.text: i like the large screen size, but the garmin gps has steered us wrong at three different locations--in large metro areas.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P

customer_reviews.title: Big screen
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this a 5 star is because I typed in a destination when we were on a trip, but the garmin couldn't find the place I was looking for. Typed in the same information in my I-phone using the maps app and the place came right up. Had to type in several different ways before finding the destination on the garmin. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: GAGIRL02

customer_reviews.title: Accidently put the unit into battery saver mode.
customer_reviews.text: Could not re-start the unit with the button on the back or by plugging it into the 120Volt charger. Thought the unit had had a serious fault. Then I plugged it into the 12Volt car charger as a last resort. It started up immediately. I let it charge for a few moments, then turned it off and on with the button on the back and it worked fine thereafter. Once you get used to the way the programs work, it is a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingham

customer_reviews.title: Definately recommeded
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this after returning a "factory certified" unit that did not work. Double the price but it is a newer unit and larger screen. This is the second Garmin unit I own with the other one being "antique" (2008 model). This one does everything but tell you what you ate last week, really impress so far. Still learning all that it does, but highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this Garmin!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on 11 hour drive to Florida. My first Garmin as I usually just use my phone. Never again will I use a phone gps! This thing worked perfectly to shorten time avoid slow traffic and road work. Best money ever spent!! Must have for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Big screen size, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Love the size of the screen and easy to use. I used it for a trip from CO to VT and it was helpful when it would ask if I wanted to stop somewhere for a break after so much time of driving. Nice reminder to take a breather when driving. It even works out in the middle of nowhere when you’re phone isn’t even working. The only thing I’d be mindful of, is you do have to keep it plugged in for most of the time. I’ve found the battery doesn’t last that long. But other than that, it’s a fantastic GPS!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Great at showing what lane to be in. Drove into NY City over unfamiliar route, George Washington bridge to Queens, had no trouble because of easy to see directions and easy to see correct lane position on seeing screen and with audio confirmation. Much better than using the iPhone 8 which we loved. We mounted ours on a Garmin friction mat, the newer one, not the older 3 legged floppy one. Only a couple trips so far. Will write scathing review if it craps out.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS for business
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS for my truck. Awesome screen, easy to use. Get the additional beanbag mounting bracket, MUCH better than the suction cup mount. Much better software than previous GPS versions. Connects to WIFI to download updates. Easy to save addresses and locations. BIG screen, easy to see. Big buttons for large fingers. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kopan Construction LLC

customer_reviews.title: I also like that it displays the name of the street I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a larger display than my previous GPS, and the turn-by-turn instructions are clearer. I also like that it displays the name of the street I'm driving on, the alerts, and the arrangement of the displays and buttons. On the other hand that battery will only stay charged for about a day. For some reason, when there is no destination set, instead of showing the upcoming cross streets it shows the distance to some random saved destination. It's difficult to set the volume precisely. The menu system is confusing at times.
customer_reviews.author: jtempler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always tell me if there's traffic slowed ahead, even if I am moving at 2mph
customer_reviews.text: Huge screen - when I hit Saved Places, it only shows me the last destination. Rarely does it understand my Voice Command and I must type the address in. Hardly ever connects automatically with my phone or Jabro overhead speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Much better than our cars navigation system
customer_reviews.text: The voice interface was very easy to use and very helpful to search for gas or food on the fly. Would like to see the ability to cancel a destination that has been added to a route without stopping the entire route. Had an issue with a section of I-75 that thought the minimum speed was a speed limit for a few miles. A button to report that then upload a discrepancy report when connected to a wifi would be cool. Touch screen was much easier to use over the older Nuvi Garmin units
customer_reviews.author: Mike Caudill

customer_reviews.title: my husband likes it :)
customer_reviews.text: it was a gift for my husband, and he seemed really happy with the options, especially the automatic update option.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features, if only they worked.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is just this refurbished unit, but it continuously had problems acquiring a GPS signal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was quite easy to set up and not very different from a previous Garmin I had for several years. The larger screen is easier to read, however it is almost too large for the small 3series station wagon I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Rs6096

customer_reviews.title: Search engine
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to search and find the route, even with keyed in address or name of the building in Vancouver BC, Canada.
customer_reviews.author: KS Leung

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: My 2797 is more accurate, but this does have some nice features. Easier to change route. Shows you the next 3 upcoming turns. Can use a backup camera with this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS, but died recently. Working with Support.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this GPS and thought I would stick with it for a long time. 15 months in, it is dead though. UPDATE Garmin responded to my service request very quickly and is being very helpful. Will update again
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  This is a great item!
customer_reviews.text: Love all the features of this Garmin DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S with Lifetime Maps and Traffic, Live Parking, Bluetooth, WiFi, Smart notifications, etc. Being of "advanced age" it's taking a little bit of time to get used to using it and all the features. Thankful we have a grandson who was able to download, sync, etc. it with our iPhones. It is totally amazing to be able to use the GPS as a phone, get news up-dates, parking information, etc. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: grandma3677

customer_reviews.title: Does Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Main reason for purchase was to avoid traffic jams and it works great for that. Couple it with your I-Phone and you get real time traffic data and alternate routes to avoid traffic jams.
customer_reviews.author: Doug H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with voice commands
customer_reviews.text: Large screen is easy to see. Voice commands make it easy to use. Just say address and it plans your route. Plan route on cell phone and it carries over. Updates by Bluetooth are great. Unit always has the updated information
customer_reviews.author: Dave Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I had a tiny garmin I bought for $75 and bought this one on prime day for about 50% off! Perfect unit, voice recognition is great, nice 7" screen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GPS
customer_reviews.text: This was a a gift for my father-in-law who is not very tech savvy. It was very easy for him to use, especially that fact that it is voice activated and give directions well before the exit with visuals! This was exactly what we were looks for. Easy visuals, voice activated, touch screen and easy programming. He loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Garmin DriveSmart 61 NA LMT-S with Lifetime Maps/Traffic, Live Parking, Bluetooth,WiFi, Smart Notifications, Voice Activation, Driver Alerts, TripAdvisor, Foursquare
product_meta.description: Size:6.95"| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingStay connected behind the wheel with Garmin DriveSmart, the navigator that features a collection of smart features in addition to helpful driver alerts and easy-to-follow directions. From hands-free calling and live traffic information to Built-in Wi-Fi and more -the future is on your Garmin. Just look ahead and drive. The display size is 6.0 x 3.5 inches (15.2 x 8.9 cm)
feature_bullets: Easy to use GPS navigator with connected Features and bright 6.95 Inch Capacitive touch display. The display resolution is 1024 x 600 pixels
Detailed maps of North America with free lifetime updates. Battery : Rechargeable lithium ion. Battery life is up to 1 hour
Provides real time services, such as Live traffic and select Live parking, when using free smartphone link app on your compatible smartphone
Bluetooth calling, smart notifications and voice activated navigation. This USB mass storage device is compatible with Windows XP or newer and Mac OS X 10.4 or later
Built in Wi Fi for easy map and software updates

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,724 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: USB cable, Vehicle suction cup mount, Quick start manual, Garmin DriveSmart, Vehicle power cable
